content.p: In the Department of Classics and Archaeology we combine theoretically informed research with cutting-edge scientific techniques and facilities to advance our knowledge of past societies. In REF21 our Department was ranked 10th in the UK, and 6th for research power, which takes into account the size of the Department. Our students play a significant role in contributing to and maintaining the momentum of our research activities. Key themes and priority areas in the Department Current individual research projects Research centres, networks and connections Staff research profiles and expertise Upcoming and past research seminars and conferences Research and study programmes Find out more about research ethics Full REF 2021 information The Norfolk community uncovering its own past Material evidence of the ancient Silk Road Changing perceptions of ancient Sparta See more examples of the impact of our research Contact details Archaeology twitter Classics twitter
